trans-unit.source: Defines the information for the refresh of a registration entry by a peer resolver service.
When a peer resolver service refreshes an entry, it sets a new expiry on that entry.

An instance of this object must be supplied to the peer resolver service for each peer node that should have its expiration refreshed; otherwise, the entry is marked as stale and will be deleted after a specific interval for cleanup has passed.
Instances of this class are primarily used to pass information to the resolver service from a network client of that service.
Initializes a new default instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.PeerResolvers.RefreshInfo"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.PeerResolvers.RefreshInfo"></xref> class with the provided mesh ID and unique registration ID.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that identifies the mesh in which the peer node participates.
A <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> that uniquely identifies the registration entry for the peer node.
Indicates whether the body of the message containing a serialized instance of this type is correctly formed.
True if the refresh information message body is correctly formed by the sender (the service client); false if it is not.
Gets the mesh ID of the registration entry to refresh.
<xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the mesh ID of the registration entry that will be refreshed in the peer resolver registration lookup table.
Gets the unique registration ID of the registration entry to refresh.
<xref href="System.Guid"></xref> that contains the registration ID of the peer node whose entry will be refreshed in the peer resolver registration lookup table.
